programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate a government agency that claims it owns drives and gardens of private properties - and has the right to sell them.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin examine the potential of a pair of flats in Clay Cross, Chesterfield, a two-bed apartment in South Norwood, London and a plot of land in Stafford.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A couple restoring a house, who had earlier disagreed about installing CCTV, but later found the cameras proved their worth after an intruder invaded their dream home. Plus, the man robbing a pizza takeaway who got a taste of his own medicine when another thief took his bike. Presented by Dom Littlewood.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross is joined by experts Thomas Plant and Nick Hall at Nottingham racecourse, and finds out how black and immigrant miners helped fuel Nottinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: An uncomfortable encounter awaits Leonie, while Mark's resolve is tested.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin visits Shropshire in search of a country home for a pair of free spirits who have a £300,000 budget with which to finally lay down some roots. Jonnie also gets in the saddle on a ride through the Shropshire hills with a bespoke bike builder.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an abstract artist, an intuitive painter, and a stained glass worker to create a bespoke piece for buyers in Cheddar who want something uplifting.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades narrates an insight into the maritime history of three items restored on programme - a precious box, a book of cuttings about Captain Scott, and a handmade teddy bear.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A classic episode from 2019 featuring Walford's first ever Gay Pride. Callum gets more than he bargained for when Tina ropes him in to help with the Pride celebrations - but he is mortified when Stuart turns up and tells him he saw him kissing Ben the night before. Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. Meanwhile, Kat calls a meeting about the stolen money and Iqra delivers Adam an ultimatum.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: A media campaign is launched to find the baby, with Jack giving a press conference outside the hospital. The renewed interest in the case puts pressure on Agatha to conceal the truth as Hayden's return brings her closer to having her perfect family.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David and Michael struggle to regain each other's trust, and a show producer has to step in to try and repair the damage. Meanwhile, Michael gets drawn deeper into the situation with his neighbour, and David is worried about Georgia's plans to help a friend who is in labour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: I May Destroy You
programme.desc: Arabella encounters her attacker David, and asks Terry and Theo to help her get revenge. Approaching him in a nightclub, they plan to dose him with the same sedative he used on her. However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. Conclusion of the drama written by and starring Michaela Coel.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? With Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle's daughter Lola gets a homemade prom in the back garden, complete with balloons, corsages, slow dancing and a surprise guest. The Drag Race judge also chats to Community's Joel McHale about how he has been coping with lockdown, and challenges comedian Alan Carr to a game of Would You Rather?(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: A busy night shift begins with Chelsey and Dave providing back-up for advanced paramedic Rob at a road traffic accident, where a driver has overturned his car at a roundabout. It is clear he has been drinking, meaning once they have assessed him, he will be answering questions from the police. Eric and Emily are dispatched to an 83-year-old who is in a lot of pain from her back, after which they answer a call from the police to a suspected assault on a 12-year-old, while senior paramedic Tony is called out to a man found slumped in his car in the city centre.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: A woman whose husband paid £85,000 for collectible gold coins learns what they are really worth, and the couriers who did a runner after being hired to move valuable items.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits an old workshop in Margate in Kent and a building plot in Newcastle-under-Lyme. Martel Maxwell is at a semi-detached house in Wednesbury, West Midlands, that has some worrying cracks.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A customer thrown out of a bar takes revenge by driving into a group of locals outside, and the owner of a restaurant catches a group planning to leave without paying.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Tim Weeks and Colin Young help the reds and blue teams find bargains in the antique shops of York, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits the National Railway Museum.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Family strains show for Sully and his mother, and Sabine turns matchmaker for Mich.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson crosses the Solent to property shop on the Isle of Wight with a couple who have a £750,000 budget to find their dream island home with holiday-let potential. During his journey, the presenter also gets an intimate glimpse into 19th-century royal life when he visits Osbourne House, one of Queen Victoria's favourite homes.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges a sculptor, a ceramicist and a painter to create something to celebrate a couple's 25th wedding anniversary, on a budget of £800.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores how the invention of clockwork continues to influence modern life, using archive and three barn fixes - a centuries-old clock, a toy and a clocking-off machine.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers. Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second half of the Premier League fixture at Turf Moor, as the Clarets host Nuno Espirito Santo's Wolves. The sides shared the spoils in the reverse fixture, which took place back in August. Ashley Barnes gave Sean Dyche's men an early lead, but the home team rescued a point thanks to Raul Jiminez's penalty deep into stoppage time.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four more treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life, tackling a radio that survived Dunkirk, a battered leather gaming case, a grandfather clock with a poignant history, and a pair of Viking statues.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actress Felicity Montagu, musician Lady Leshurr, travel presenter Amar Latif, and TV presenters Gethin Jones and Jeff Brazier enter the studios to demonstrate their culinary skills. Gethin, Jeff and Lady Leshurr head to Pomana's, while Felicity and Amar cook for paying customers at Mortimer House Kitchen in a busy lunchtime service. Then it's back to the MasterChef kitchen to impress John and Gregg with their own creations. Who will have the culinary flair and skills to impress the judges?(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Action from the latest Premier League contests, as the teams aimed to pick up valuable results with just two further rounds of fixtures remaining. Wednesday's games were Arsenal v Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium, Manchester City v Bournemouth at the Etihad Stadium, Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park, and Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Turf Moor. Plus, highlights of Monday and Tuesday's matches, which were Manchester United v Southampton at Old Trafford and Chelsea v Norwich City at Stamford Bridge, respectively.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Four-time World Superbikes champion Carl Fogarty, Great Britain sprinter Imani-Lara Lansiquot, former England striker Kevin Phillips and world Taekwondo champion Bianca Walkden join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: An investigation into a fake tax scam designed to relieve people of their money and how fake celebrity endorsements are used to make dodgy deals look legitimate.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts revisits a listed building in Rochester, Kent, and looks round an end terrace in Rhondda Cynon Taff, south Wales. Dion Dublin checks out a Birmingham semi-detached.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Local people join forces with the police to help catch a thief when a pub landlady has money stolen that was meant for her seriously ill daughter. Dominic Littlewood presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the antique fair at Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, with experts Gary Pe and David Harper helping the contestants.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Doing their daughter's birthday on a budget causes stress for Mark and Renee. Leonie makes a drastic decision when she realises work is getting in the way of family.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple looking for a home in rural Cambridgeshire, and also visits National Trust nature reserve Wicken Fen - one of the most important wetlands in Europe..(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A metal sculptor, a stained-glass designer and a textile artist pitch ideas for a Derby couple's wedding, with only two being made before the buyers choose their favourite.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: The importance of music in people's lives, through the restoration of a pump organ, an accordion and a bass guitar owned by a member of 1970s disco group Hot Chocolate.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones host the magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Last night saw actress Felicity Montagu, singer Lady Leshurr and presenters Amar Latif, Gethin Jones and Jeff Brazier enter the fray. But one of them has already been voted out, leaving the other four to cook on. They begin with the pairs task, for which they are split into teams and have to serve up identical dishes - all while separated by a wall. The second challenge sees them entering the world of mass catering at the Wellcome Genome Campus in Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the latest Premier League contests, as the teams aimed to pick up valuable results with just two further rounds of fixtures remaining. Thursday's games were Crystal Palace v Manchester United at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Sheffield United at the King Power Stadium, Everton v Aston Villa at Goodison Park, and Southampton v Brighton & Hove Albion at St Mary's Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Adam Fleming, Laura Kuenssberg and Fergus Walsh discuss the latest on the coronavirus pandemic..(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford and Angela Rippon report on builder-checking websites, in regard to how extensively those sites check out the traders they list. Plus, a couple's two-year battle with one of the biggest names in insurance.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a cemetery lodge in the Cumbria town of Maryport and a house in Neath Port Talbot, and Dion Dublin casts his eye over a commercial unit in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A family's horrific ordeal when masked thieves burst into its home. Plus, how a bungling bike thief looking to steal a new set of wheels ended getting a ride in a police car.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Gary Pe and Nick Hall help two teams look for items in the West Sussex town of Ardingly, while presenter Anita Manning investigates the history of funfairs.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Ash reacts badly to an insinuation, while the hospital ball sees one relationship flourish while another founders. Australian drama, starring Fiona Press and Mitchell Bourke.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton accompanies a couple on a North Yorkshire house hunt. They are calling time on running a guest house in the city and have a £650 000 budget to find a rural family home with business potential. Whilst in the county, Alistair also pays a visit to a heritage train line and helps the team to get their impressive locomotives fired up for the start of the tourist season.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the First World War's legacy on the UK today, through archive and delving deeper into three barn fixes - some bagpipes, a soldier's wire cutters and two RAF mascots.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Welsh international footballer Hal Robson-Kanu, British athletics great Colin Jackson, rugby league legend Paul Sculthorpe and world champion boxer Terri Harper join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four remaining contestants battling to remain in the contest, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champions Phil Vickery, Lisa Faulkner and John Partridge. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.title: Jack Whitehall's Sporting Nation
programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: Kayleigh has had enough of work and fancies a day off, but John is not having any of it - or is he? Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Olympics 2012
programme.desc: A look back at the show produced by Trainspotting and Slumdog Millionaire director Danny Boyle, which marked the start of the London 2012 Olympic Games. The ceremony reflected the key themes and priorities of the event, based on sport, inspiration, youth and urban transformation, and celebrated the contributions made by the UK to the world through innovation, as well as the creativity of British people.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Theo Randall and Shivi Ramoutar, and a special guest joins via video link. Plus, archive clips from Rick Stein, Keith Floyd and Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on wild food, cooking gnocchi with smoked haddock and wild greens, with chef Billy Boyter and crime writer Val McDermid.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents a look ahead to the weekend's football, including Arsenal v Manchester City and Manchester United v Chelsea in the FA Cup semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The first of three parts of a look back at the Games, including the exploits of cyclists Lizzie Armistead and Chris Hoy.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Continuing the look back at the Games, focusing on 'Super Saturday', when Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford all claimed athletics gold medals.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In the suburbs of Bristol, Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich turn a long, pointed front garden into a water-saving, wildlife-friendly space.(n)

programme.title: Maleficent
programme.desc: A fairy falls in love with an ambitious human nobleman, who betrays her in pursuit of claiming the throne. She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Actor Dylan Llewellyn, TV presenter Claire McCollum, digital content creator Caspar Lee, and Radio One DJ Rickie Haywood-Williams return to the spotlight, answering questions on specialist subjects Quentin Tarantino Films, 1980s Television, YouTube and Game of Thrones.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman invite another selection of famous faces to take part in the unorthodox general knowledge quiz. Those standing behind the podiums this week are actors Michael Sheen, Steve Pemberton and Mark Benton, impressionist Jess Robinson, entertainers Anita Harris and Bobby Crush and former footballers Neil Ruddock and Steve McMahon.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: When Lev is called to help a patient, Evgeny, who has been stabbed, he is delighted to find out that he is Russian, and the pair bond over their similar heritage. However, he soon finds himself reflecting on disturbing and traumatic memories from his own past and his childhood in Russia. Meanwhile, Jan forgets to buy an anniversary gift for her wife, Ffion, and promise to make it up to her, but an emergency means that Jan has to put her work her relationship once more. Elsewhere, Charlie decides to take a step back.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section. This time, Mo Gilligan and Anne-Marie pop by for a chat and a game of Musical VAR, and Jamie Redknapp takes on Dina Asher-Smith in The Sporting Fix. Plus, Zara Larsson performs in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Hot Property
programme.desc: Filly meets his match with eccentric Adam, a louder-than-life student who loves to sing about gonorrhoea.(n)

programme.title: Short Term 12
programme.desc: A counsellor at a foster care centre for troubled teenagers tries to help a gifted newcomer realise her talents and assists a 17-year-old in dealing with the prospect of having to leave the facility when he turns 18. However, helping them get a good start in life forces her to come to terms with her own difficult past. Drama, starring Brie Larson and John Gallagher Jr.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Sally Phillips take a look at the week's talking points and explore the ethical and religious issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Lynne Donnelly wants to move to Australia, so she takes her family for a trial week in Melbourne in the hope of convincing them to leave their home in Scotland for good.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Charles Hanson are in Oswestry, Shropshire, to help two teams look for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp has advice on collectibles from occupied Japan.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley finds out about the vicars of Eyam, Derbyshire, who initiated a lockdown 355 years ago to protect the rest of northern England from the bubonic plague.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore returns to transform more items reclaimed from a tip, beginning by rescuing a granite worktop from Altrincham Recycling Centre in Greater Manchester.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third and final part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant from This Distance - General Sedgwick
programme.desc: A truce with the Weekday Warriors proves short-lived, Alaska sets Miles up on his very first date at the school's basketball game, and Takumi has a suspicion who the rat might be.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: The Nourishment Is Palatable - Millard Fillmore
programme.desc: Miles agrees to spend Thanksgiving with Alaska, but a trip to the Colonel's home for the holiday that was designed to bring everyone together only leaves the group further apart.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: The return of the programme offering advice about which foods are healthy or harmful. Chris Bavin investigates worrying reports that eating chicken and turkey could cause cancer, and Gloria Hunniford looks at the trend for feeding pets raw meat.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.desc: Last night saw actress Felicity Montagu, singer Lady Leshurr and presenters Amar Latif, Gethin Jones and Jeff Brazier enter the fray. But one of them has already been voted out, leaving the other four to cook on. They begin with the pairs task, for which they are split into teams and have to serve up identical dishes - all while separated by a wall. The second challenge sees them entering the world of mass catering at the Wellcome Genome Campus in Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four remaining contestants battling to remain in the contest, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champions Phil Vickery, Lisa Faulkner and John Partridge. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.title: Jack Whitehall's Sporting Nation
programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: Kayleigh has had enough of work and fancies a day off, but John is not having any of it - or is he? Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.desc: Continuing the look back at the Games, focusing on 'Super Saturday', when Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford all claimed athletics gold medals.(n)

programme.title: Politics England

programme.title: Countryfile

Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: When Lev is called to help a patient, Evgeny, who has been stabbed, he is delighted to find out that he is Russian, and the pair bond over their similar heritage. However, he soon finds himself reflecting on disturbing and traumatic memories from his own past and his childhood in Russia. Meanwhile, Jan forgets to buy an anniversary gift for her wife, Ffion, and promise to make it up to her, but an emergency means that Jan has to put her work her relationship once more. Elsewhere, Charlie decides to take a step back.(n)

This time, Mo Gilligan and Anne-Marie pop by for a chat and a game of Musical VAR, and Jamie Redknapp takes on Dina Asher-Smith in The Sporting Fix. Plus, Zara Larsson performs in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day

Thursday's games were Crystal Palace v Manchester United at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Sheffield United at the King Power Stadium, Everton v Aston Villa at Goodison Park, and Southampton v Brighton & Hove Albion at St Mary's Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Adam Fleming, Laura Kuenssberg and Fergus Walsh discuss the latest on the coronavirus pandemic..(n)

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford and Angela Rippon report on builder-checking websites, in regard to how extensively those sites check out the traders they list. Plus, a couple's two-year battle with one of the biggest names in insurance.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a cemetery lodge in the Cumbria town of Maryport and a house in Neath Port Talbot, and Dion Dublin casts his eye over a commercial unit in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A family's horrific ordeal when masked thieves burst into its home. Plus, how a bungling bike thief looking to steal a new set of wheels ended getting a ride in a police car.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Gary Pe and Nick Hall help two teams look for items in the West Sussex town of Ardingly, while presenter Anita Manning investigates the history of funfairs.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Ash reacts badly to an insinuation, while the hospital ball sees one relationship flourish while another founders. Australian drama, starring Fiona Press and Mitchell Bourke.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton accompanies a couple on a North Yorkshire house hunt. They are calling time on running a guest house in the city and have a £650 000 budget to find a rural family home with business potential. Whilst in the county, Alistair also pays a visit to a heritage train line and helps the team to get their impressive locomotives fired up for the start of the tourist season.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the First World War's legacy on the UK today, through archive and delving deeper into three barn fixes - some bagpipes, a soldier's wire cutters and two RAF mascots.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Welsh international footballer Hal Robson-Kanu, British athletics great Colin Jackson, rugby league legend Paul Sculthorpe and world champion boxer Terri Harper join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four remaining contestants battling to remain in the contest, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champions Phil Vickery, Lisa Faulkner and John Partridge. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.title: Jack Whitehall's Sporting Nation
programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.title: Keepin 'er Country
programme.desc: Documentary series following the stories of Northern Ireland's country music enthusiasts. This edition focuses on Ireland's biggest truck show, meeting the lorry-loving women who spend hundreds of thousands on their vehicles to keep them in tip-top condition, and the men who combine their weekly workload with pulling up to country music festivals at the weekends.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: Kayleigh has had enough of work and fancies a day off, but John is not having any of it - or is he? Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Olympics 2012
programme.desc: A look back at the show produced by Trainspotting and Slumdog Millionaire director Danny Boyle, which marked the start of the London 2012 Olympic Games. The ceremony reflected the key themes and priorities of the event, based on sport, inspiration, youth and urban transformation, and celebrated the contributions made by the UK to the world through innovation, as well as the creativity of British people.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Theo Randall and Shivi Ramoutar, and a special guest joins via video link. Plus, archive clips from Rick Stein, Keith Floyd and Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on wild food, cooking gnocchi with smoked haddock and wild greens, with chef Billy Boyter and crime writer Val McDermid.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents a look ahead to the weekend's football, including Arsenal v Manchester City and Manchester United v Chelsea in the FA Cup semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The first of three parts of a look back at the Games, including the exploits of cyclists Lizzie Armistead and Chris Hoy.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Continuing the look back at the Games, focusing on 'Super Saturday', when Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford all claimed athletics gold medals.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In the suburbs of Bristol, Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich turn a long, pointed front garden into a water-saving, wildlife-friendly space.(n)

programme.title: Maleficent
programme.desc: A fairy falls in love with an ambitious human nobleman, who betrays her in pursuit of claiming the throne. She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Actor Dylan Llewellyn, TV presenter Claire McCollum, digital content creator Caspar Lee, and Radio One DJ Rickie Haywood-Williams return to the spotlight, answering questions on specialist subjects Quentin Tarantino Films, 1980s Television, YouTube and Game of Thrones.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman invite another selection of famous faces to take part in the unorthodox general knowledge quiz. Those standing behind the podiums this week are actors Michael Sheen, Steve Pemberton and Mark Benton, impressionist Jess Robinson, entertainers Anita Harris and Bobby Crush and former footballers Neil Ruddock and Steve McMahon.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: When Lev is called to help a patient, Evgeny, who has been stabbed, he is delighted to find out that he is Russian, and the pair bond over their similar heritage. However, he soon finds himself reflecting on disturbing and traumatic memories from his own past and his childhood in Russia. Meanwhile, Jan forgets to buy an anniversary gift for her wife, Ffion, and promise to make it up to her, but an emergency means that Jan has to put her work her relationship once more. Elsewhere, Charlie decides to take a step back.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section. This time, Mo Gilligan and Anne-Marie pop by for a chat and a game of Musical VAR, and Jamie Redknapp takes on Dina Asher-Smith in The Sporting Fix. Plus, Zara Larsson performs in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Hot Property
programme.desc: Filly meets his match with eccentric Adam, a louder-than-life student who loves to sing about gonorrhoea.(n)

programme.title: Short Term 12
programme.desc: A counsellor at a foster care centre for troubled teenagers tries to help a gifted newcomer realise her talents and assists a 17-year-old in dealing with the prospect of having to leave the facility when he turns 18. However, helping them get a good start in life forces her to come to terms with her own difficult past. Drama, starring Brie Larson and John Gallagher Jr.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third and final part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Gardening Together with Diarmuid Gavin
programme.desc: The horticultural designer encourages people across Ireland to get out in their gardens, taking calls, answering questions and offering a range of practical tips. In the first edition, he helps design a garden for Mary Fitzpatrick in Co Wicklow, and creates a sunken fire pit and seating area in his own patch.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.title: Staged

programme.desc: A classic episode from 2019 featuring Walford's first ever Gay Pride. Callum gets more than he bargained for when Tina ropes him in to help with the Pride celebrations - but he is mortified when Stuart turns up and tells him he saw him kissing Ben the night before. Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. Meanwhile, Kat calls a meeting about the stolen money and Iqra delivers Adam an ultimatum.(n)

programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

They begin with the pairs task, for which they are split into teams and have to serve up identical dishes - all while separated by a wall. The second challenge sees them entering the world of mass catering at the Wellcome Genome Campus in Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four remaining contestants battling to remain in the contest, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champions Phil Vickery, Lisa Faulkner and John Partridge. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary series following the stories of Northern Ireland's country music enthusiasts. This edition focuses on Ireland's biggest truck show, meeting the lorry-loving women who spend hundreds of thousands on their vehicles to keep them in tip-top condition, and the men who combine their weekly workload with pulling up to country music festivals at the weekends.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

The ceremony reflected the key themes and priorities of the event, based on sport, inspiration, youth and urban transformation, and celebrated the contributions made by the UK to the world through innovation, as well as the creativity of British people.(n)

However, he soon finds himself reflecting on disturbing and traumatic memories from his own past and his childhood in Russia. Meanwhile, Jan forgets to buy an anniversary gift for her wife, Ffion, and promise to make it up to her, but an emergency means that Jan has to put her work her relationship once more. Elsewhere, Charlie decides to take a step back.(n)

The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A classic episode from 2019 featuring Walford's first ever Gay Pride. Callum gets more than he bargained for when Tina ropes him in to help with the Pride celebrations - but he is mortified when Stuart turns up and tells him he saw him kissing Ben the night before. Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. Meanwhile, Kat calls a meeting about the stolen money and Iqra delivers Adam an ultimatum.(n)

Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.desc: David and Michael struggle to regain each other's trust, and a show producer has to step in to try and repair the damage. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal

programme.title: I May Destroy You

However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. Conclusion of the drama written by and starring Michaela Coel.(n)

Eric and Emily are dispatched to an 83-year-old who is in a lot of pain from her back, after which they answer a call from the police to a suspected assault on a 12-year-old, while senior paramedic Tony is called out to a man found slumped in his car in the city centre.(n)

The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champions Phil Vickery, Lisa Faulkner and John Partridge. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.desc: Armchair fan Jack turns his comedic sights on Britain's attitude towards its sporting heroes, examining the delight the nation takes in building its sports stars up, as well as bringing them crashing down again. From the red cards and free kicks of David Beckham to Andy Murray's difficult route to the top of tennis and Zola Budd's infamous 1984 Olympic tangle, Jack looks at why it doesn't matter how incredibly talented a person is - if they want to become a British hero, they are not in for an easy ride.(n)

programme.desc: Fed up with Cathy festering in her bed, post-wedding cancellation, and stalking Marcus and Meredith on what was supposed to be Cathy and Marcus' honeymoon, Cat decides the best thing to cheer up her half-sibling is to take her away on their own 'sister honeymoon'. She's got just the place in mind - their late Dad's favourite pub. At the solicitors, Marilyn and Tess learn that Colin's will contains an absolute bombshell and that they must pass on some shocking news to their daughters. Comedy, starring Ellie White, Lauren Socha, Siobhan Finneran and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon brings in a friend to try to convince his two stars to put their faith in him, while Michael worries about a neighbour when he spots an ambulance outside next door. David not only manages to keep the house in order and the home-schooling ticking over in Georgia's absence, but also gets around to finishing a draft of his screenplay.(n)

programme.title: Enterprice

Out of their comfort zone, they head to the East End to meet the girls, but what follows is a very strange dinner - which goes from bad to worse very quickly. Return of the comedy, starring Kayode Ewumi and Trieve Blackwood-Cambridge.(n)

programme.desc: A classic episode from 2019 featuring Walford's first ever Gay Pride. Callum gets more than he bargained for when Tina ropes him in to help with the Pride celebrations - but he is mortified when Stuart turns up and tells him he saw him kissing Ben the night before. Karen rounds up the family to celebrate Bernadette's first Pride, although Bernadette herself does not seem in the mood. Meanwhile, Kat calls a meeting about the stolen money and Iqra delivers Adam an ultimatum.(n)

programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.desc: David and Michael struggle to regain each other's trust, and a show producer has to step in to try and repair the damage. programme.desc: Arabella encounters her attacker David, and asks Terry and Theo to help her get revenge. Approaching him in a nightclub, they plan to dose him with the same sedative he used on her. However, when he gets away from them, they are forced to use increasingly violent methods to subdue him. As the long night draws to a close, Arabella finds her memories of the night coming into sharper focus, and is forced to quickly come to terms with both her own secrets and those of David. Conclusion of the drama written by and starring Michaela Coel.(n)

Eric and Emily are dispatched to an 83-year-old who is in a lot of pain from her back, after which they answer a call from the police to a suspected assault on a 12-year-old, while senior paramedic Tony is called out to a man found slumped in his car in the city centre.(n)
