programme.desc: When Nandor and Laszlo are abducted by a coven of witches, the others must venture to Brooklyn to rescue them.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The vampires prepare to attend the most exclusive event on the vampiric social calendar..(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: India plans an airport-inspired wedding, with a cup cake trolley dash for the passenger wedding guests and some tricky manoeuvring to guide her mother down the aisle.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood introduce another selection of clips, this time featuring pets, including a trip to a rabbit island, and a rat that chases cats.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and friends compete in a pedal car grand prix in Dorset..(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Blue Peter: Six Badges of Summer - Silver Week
programme.desc: The team present the last Six Badges of Summer show. Online campaigner Nikki Lilly reveals why viewers should earn their Silver Badge, Richie Driss tells his story in Draw My Life and chart star Becky Hill performs her new single Heaven on My Mind.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall sets out to visit six continents in search of Earth's 60 deadliest animals.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Moon
programme.desc: Using the latest and most detailed imagery, this documentary reveals the monthly life cycle of the moon as it waxes and wanes. From Wales to Wyoming, and from Hong Kong to Croydon, the programme explores how the moon shapes life across the planet earth, and uncovers more about the moon's journey around our planet and how it delivers one of nature's most awe-inspiring events, a total solar eclipse.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Golf: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at how Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy have fared at the Open, featuring contributions from all three golfers.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Golf: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at how Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus have fared at the Open, featuring first-hand accounts from the trio as they recount their victories.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain concludes her culinary road trip by sampling what Wales has to offer. She heads to the Brecon Beacons National Park to meet sheep farmer Richard Roderick, who gives her a crash course in the essential skills of a shepherdess. In return, she cooks him lamb bhuna, served with garlic naan. In Monmouth, Nadiya visits Desdemona Freeman and Denise Jones, the UK's only homegrown edible rosewater makers, harvesting petals and creating a rose and raspberry fool.(n)

programme.title: The Good Cook
programme.desc: Food writer Simon Hopkinson demonstrates how to create restaurant-quality food at home, preparing stuffed roasted peppers, steak and chips, aubergines with feta cheese, smoked haddock pilaf, and a rhubarb crumble. He also discusses his love of olive oil and Guernsey cream.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk and Anna Haugh prepare George V's favourite curry, Polly Russell discovers how Francis Drake solved a debt crisis and the secrets of a famous condiment are revealed.(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A bored millionaire masterminds a bank robbery, only to find himself pursued by a glamorous insurance investigator determined to prove his guilt. It is not long before they get embroiled in a passionate affair - but conflicting interests mean they can never really trust one another. Crime drama, starring Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke and Yaphet Kotto.(n)

programme.title: Bears About the House
programme.desc: Part one of two. Conservationist Giles Clark embarks on his biggest mission to date - taking on the illegal wildlife trade and helping to build a new bear sanctuary in Laos, south-east Asia. Giles has been asked by good friend Matt Hunt, CEO of Free the Bears, to help for 12 months and is not long into his role when he has to step in to help Mary, a five-month-old sun bear. Mary was rescued after her mother was killed in the wild and was spotted on the back of a truck for sale into the illegal wildlife trade. Fragile and malnourished, she lives with Giles and Matt at home while she needs round-the-clock specialist care.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Michael Portillo rides the transcontinental Indian Pacific Railway from the southern port city of Adelaide to Perth in the west. Along the way he hears the story of how an enterprising 19th-century Briton with a murky past began to grow vines. Michael enjoys the fruits of his labours and hears his story from his great great great granddaughter. Later, the presenter embraces the luxury of a previous age as he travels across Australia's notoriously remote and inhospitable Nullarbor Plain.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: Historian David Olusoga follows the story of the Liverpool house from 1891 to 1945, a turbulent 50-year period encompassing two world wars and the Great Depression. For most of that time, it was home to the Snewings, a large family of saddlers. David follows their business through challenging times - death in the family, cut-throat competition, the First World War and the age of the motor car. With their departure came Jack Greenall, a docker keeping a secret from his employees, and then the Duffys, a couple both trying to escape unhappy childhoods.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.sub-title: The Open Championship 2019 - How Shane Won the Claret Jug
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at Shane Lowry's triumph on home soil at Royal Portrush, setting a new course record on day three en route to winning by six shots in front of a passionate crowd. Actor James Nesbitt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day three of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. This is the first meeting between the sides here in this format since June 2007, when England prevailed by 60 runs. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: British History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley explores how in 1873 the British government enacted a coup to take over the rule of India from the huge and influential Honourable East India Company. The leaders of the company were presented as the villains, while Queen Victoria was elevated to the role of wise and benevolent Empress.(n)

programme.title: The Duchess
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama, chronicling the life of Georgiana Spencer who became Duchess of Devonshire in 1774 at the age of 17. Adored by the public for her extravagant lifestyle, Spencer endured a troubled marriage and was eventually driven into the arms of Charles Grey, a senior Whig politician. Starring Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Rampling.(n)

programme.title: Maps to the Stars
programme.desc: A disfigured woman is hired as an assistant to a fading Hollywood star, who has become obsessed with her dead mother and is determined to recreate her most famous film role. Meanwhile, a teen idol goes off the rails under the influence of his overbearing parents and a chauffeur harbours dreams of becoming a writer. David Cronenberg's drama, starring Julianne Moore, Mia Wasikowska, John Cusack and Robert Pattinson.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, with this episode's recipes linked by the letter S. Mary Berry prepares salmon with a fresh sorrel and spinach sauce, and Nigel Slater cooks sea salt chocolate snaps.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and garden designer Danny Clarke tackle a neglected and boring backyard in Birmingham for its owner Sophie, who wants the area full of birds, bees and butterflies.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Matt Baker visit the Blean, an ancient woodland in the heart of Kent where they get an exclusive look at a unique wilding project. There is a report from Gloucestershire on the elusive pine marten, while one of the driest springs on record is causing big problems at Adam Henson's farm.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost brings viewers up-to-date on how his garden has been developing over the summer as well as offering advice on looking after and growing hydrangeas. In Devon, Toby Buckland shares tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials, while Frances Tophill travels to West Sussex to meet a gardener and professor of biology whose garden has been planted with the conservation of insects in mind. Plus, a second chance to see Carol Klein's in-depth profile of a national collection of hydrangeas at Darley Park in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Carole Baxter demonstrates the difference between a bed of hardy annuals sown in a prepared bed alongside an unprepared bed, and George Anderson shows off his Joppa allotment.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
programme.desc: The food writer turns the contents of his weekly shop into seven more meals, showing how items that he often buys can be made more exciting by concocting delicious new flavour combinations. The dishes he ends up with include ricotta beefburger, smoked mackerel coleslaw, and lemon and thyme cake.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of Si King and Dave Myers' European baking tour takes them to France. Travelling from Lyon to Carcassonne, they learn the secrets of teeth-pulling nougat, go truffle hunting and meet up with Dave's old flatmate, whom he has not seen for 30 years. Culinary delights en route include tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette.(n)

programme.title: Stories of Us
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley and broadcaster Ashley John-Baptiste reveal the inspiring stories of people across the UK who lead spiritually and emotionally fulfilling lives. In this first edition, they set out to meet the people who have found inner peace, calm and equilibrium among the hustle and bustle of modern living. Kate takes to the open waters to experience how wild swimming has been a life-changer for some - and even a life-saver for others. Meanwhile, Ashley discovers how a little time living as a hermit could ease the pressures of busy lives.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: From the RAF Museum in Cosford, Shropshire, where antique experts Jonathan Pratt and Adam Partridge find a First World War pigeon capsule and a large collection of toy cars.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Continuing the third and final part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued.(n)

programme.title: A Wild Year
programme.sub-title: The North York Moors: A Wild Year
programme.desc: An exploration of the upland area of North Yorkshire, where heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales have been shaped both by the elements and by its people. Hardy Swaledale sheep roam the high moors all year round only coming down to the lowlands for lambing and shearing. Red grouse feed and breed amongst the heather alongside curlews and other ground nesting birds and billions of purple heather blooms provide nectar for the bees, brought to the moors by beekeepers in the summer. Toby Jones narrates, as time-lapse camera techniques bring fresh insight into the restless rhythms of the region.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day four of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. It is the first time this venue has hosted a Test match since last September, when England lost the Fourth Test of the 2019 Ashes series to Australia. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Sara Davies, Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of an eco-friendly entrepreneur's alternative to straws, a range of skincare products, a device designed to make bikes more visible, and a brand of food with a personal story behind it. Evan Davis presents.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan: From My Sofa
programme.desc: Romesh catches up with old friends from Albania, Mongolia and The Arctic, revisiting some of the highlights and introducing never-before-seen moments such as his near-death experience in a high-speed Mongolia car rally.(n)

programme.title: Trump in Tweets
programme.desc: Documentary taking an in-depth look at US President Donald Trump's use of social media, examining the impact of his tweets on politics both in America and across the world. With access to people in his inner circle, interviews with experts and journalists, as well as some of his most avid Twitter followers, the programme tells the story of how Trump has used Twitter as a tool to shape policy, conduct diplomacy and wage war on the establishment. Narrated by The Vivienne.(n)

programme.title: Donald Trump: All-American Billionaire
programme.desc: In a programme first shown in 2010, well before he became US President, Emily Maitlis profiles the property tycoon, exploring the controversy surrounding his plans to develop a golf resort on sand dunes near Aberdeen. She also investigates how he amassed his multi-billion-dollar fortune, and discovers why his extravagant lifestyle serves to reinforce his business brand. Featuring interviews with Trump himself, as well as members of his family and TV producer Mark Burnett, who helped make the businessman one of America's biggest small-screen stars on the original version of The Apprentice.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Advanced paramedic Kirsten is faced with an unusual job. A call has come in from police about a burglar who has injured himself trying to escape from the house he was looting. As she arrives, she finds him in agony with a nasty open fracture on his leg. Later, Kelsey and Dave are called to a pregnant woman in a lot of pain who worries she may be in early labour, and Gareth and Gabby treat a woman who is struggling with her breathing. But then two high-priority calls come in - both of which involve children.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the First World War's legacy on the UK today, through archive and delving deeper into three barn fixes - some bagpipes, a soldier's wire cutters and two RAF mascots.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet Revisited
programme.desc: Scientists find out what the future holds for the Great Barrier Reef, monitoring green turtles, following families of breeding birds and meeting the reef's curious residents.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by David Cornock..(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces dishes that are good to make in advance, including Mary Berry's fresh fruit salad, James Martin's chicken stew, the Hairy Bikers' autumn pudding, Nigel Slater's bean soup, and Nigella Lawson's ice-cream cake.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan narrates a documentary following capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis as they strive to raise their families. The first episode sees the young animals taking their first steps in some of the world's most extraordinary habitats, where they have to beware of deadly predators including the jaguar and caiman.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The first of five programmes looking back at the 2016 Rio Olympics, focusing on the opening six days - which included Adam Peaty's 100m breaststroke gold medal in the pool.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and James Lewis scour a crowd at Ushaw in Co Durham to find objects to take off to auction. Catherine comes across a toy speedboat in its original box and James discovers a rare poster that came from a morgue which shows the average weight of adult organs. Host Paul Martin looks at some rare Catholic artefacts that survived the English Reformation.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey from Adelaide to Perth, striking gold and playing cards in Kalgoorlie, and uncovering a dark chapter of the past in Perth.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day five of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. England are hoping to avenge a series defeat away to the Windies last summer. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: The comedy of Victoria Wood is celebrated by Richard E Grant, with characters including Kimberley's friend, Jim Broadbent's northern playwright and Patricia Routledge's extraordinary monologues as Kitty. With contributions from Julie Walters and Michael Ball, as well as rare behind the scenes photos from her personal archive.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Leicester pit their wits against a team from Durham University in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Iraq
programme.desc: A look at the impact of the insurgency from the perspectives of American soldier Lt Col Nate Sassaman and Baghdadi Alaa Adel, who was 12 when she suffered life-changing injuries. Unprepared for the hostile environment he found himself in, Sassaman was pushed to the very darkest regions of his psyche. Alaa was hit in the face by shrapnel from one of the first roadside bombs planted by insurgents and intended for American forces. Looking back at that time, both question the benefits of the war in Iraq.(n)

programme.title: Strasbourg 1518
programme.desc: Jonathan Glazer's short dance film inspired by an event in which an involuntary mania took hold of citizens in the city of Strasbourg just over 500 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Wedding Planner
programme.desc: The exclusive world of Lelian Chew, who organises nuptials for the super-rich in the Far East, taking on 10 just ceremonies a year at an average cost of $1million each. Bespoke Cartier jewellery, hundreds of thousands of dollars of flowers and multiple designer wedding dresses are nothing out of the ordinary. But Lelian's job also involves navigating the clash between age-old Chinese marriage customs and the desires of the young, often with outlandish solutions - multiple weddings are becoming the norm for the Chinese super-rich.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A molten glass specialist, an Icelandic abstract artist and a self-taught metal sculptor create artworks for tottery winners who want to celebrate the day their lives changed.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades investigates the UK's espionage history through three items restored on the programme, including a bike and teapot linked to undercover operatives.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame reviews the progress of her new kitchen garden, and begins planting out peas and sowing flower seeds. Nick Bailey shows how to make an easy cold frame for storing precious plants and seedlings, and Joe Swift meets Will Young, whose new-found love of gardening was key to his recovery from mental health problems.(n)

programme.title: Into the Wild with Gordon Buchanan
programme.desc: The naturalist takes broadcaster John Simpson to the Cairngorms in search of the rarest and most elusive creature in the UK - the Scottish wildcat. On their journey the pair make their way up the mountains on the lookout for reindeer and one of the hardiest little birds, the ptarmigan. Red squirrels inhabit the pine forests as does another creature that John would love to see - the pine marten. The BBC's world affairs editor proves a fascinating companion with many tales to tell, while the duo wait for the wildlife to appear.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: Actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents another selection of recipes from TV chefs, including the likes of James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Sue Barker narrates the first part of a look back at the Games, featuring the opening six days, including gold medals for Great Britain's Rebecca Adlington and Nicole Cook in swimming and cycling respectively.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Port Augusta to Darwin - Part Two
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels on the second leg of the Ghan Railway from Alice Springs to Darwin. Along the way, he meets orphaned joeys at a kangaroo sanctuary, discovers the story of an early 20th-century cattle tycoon and meets the family that run one of his former ranches, explores traditional aboriginal lands, and joins Darwin locals in commemorating the 100th anniversary of a First World War battle.(n)

programme.title: DEC Coronavirus Appeal
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee to help those affected by Coronavirus.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The decade after the Second World War sees the Ellis family on rations without a fridge, hot water or an electric cooker. Thrifty fodder includes the regional favourites cow heel pie and Yorkshire pudding made with dried eggs, and while the cost of food is low, family spirits are high. The insecurity of the hungry thirties has been replaced by the promise of a fairer society for working class families with government commitment to full employment and better housing and healthcare. Plus, two new family members - chickens Sara and Polly - treat them to fresh eggs. Sara Cox and Polly Russell present.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti visit a hi-tech hotel in the self-governing Chinese gambling capital of Macau. Monica gets special access to a secret set of VIP suites dubbed The Mansion, where it takes more than just money to book an exclusive room. Giles visits a special theatre that sends its audience flying through the air, and helps to arrange the flowers for the Chinese New Year celebrations.(n)

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: Three-part documentary about the media mogul's influence on international politics and the power struggles within his own family. The first episode focuses on the build-up to the 1997 general election, where Rupert Murdoch had to decide if his business interests were best served by the continuation of John Major's struggling government, or a new Labour leadership under Tony Blair. Eventually, the full force of his media empire is placed behind the rising Labour leader, but some question how high a price was paid. Elsewhere, Murdoch marries a woman 37 years younger than he is, dividing his children and jeopardising his plans to choose a successor.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Frankie Boyle, Simon Evans, Aisling Bea
programme.desc: Outspoken funnyman Frankie Boyle hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before handing over to the acerbic Simon Evans and actress/stand-up Aisling Bea.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Live Aid
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the 1985 benefit concert, when stars including Elton John, Paul McCartney, Queen, David Bowie, U2 and a host of others walked out to a crowd of 72,000 at Wembley Stadium - and a global TV audience of billions - to raise money for the famine in Ethiopia. Bob Geldof and others talk about their fears at not being able to pull it off after 12 weeks of preparation, while famous music fans Tony Blair, JK Rowling and Helen Fielding remember watching it at home.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan: From My Sofa
programme.desc: The comedian revisits memorable moments from his travel series, beginning with a look back at the episodes where he explored Zimbabwe, Bosnia and the Sahara. The programme features some never-before-seen footage shot for these episodes, including the moment when Romesh tried to make a horror film in the desert.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The contest, hosted by Joe Lycett, reaches its final stage as the last three contestants take on a trio of celebration wear challenges before the winner is announced. Judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young start by challenging the sewers to make a little boys kilt without a pattern. In the Transformation Challenge, they each attempt to turn party dresses into fun outfits fit to wear at a carnival, before finally creating unique gowns using luxury fabric in the Made to Measure challenge. At the end of the three challenges, one of the competitors is crowned this year's winner.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Jim McColl and Carole Baxter are hoping there might be some early potatoes and strawberries ready to harvest. Chris Beardshaw takes on a shady location by the pond to create a new large shrub and clematis border. George Anderson visits the Japanese garden at Cowden Castle, Clackmannanshire, which dates back to the early 20th century and was the first oriental garden of its size.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining contenders face two more culinary challenges as they battle for a place in the semi-finals. First they are split into two groups for a test of teamwork and communication. One duo has to master John Torode's dim sum selection, and the other his spiced duck noodle broth. Then, the celebrities' teamwork skills are pushed to the extreme as they are faced with their first Mass Catering Challenge, cooking lunch for over 100 staff at Acton Works - the central hub for repairs and upgrades to London Underground trains.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an abstract artist, an intuitive painter, and a stained glass worker to create a bespoke piece for buyers in Cheddar who want something uplifting.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades narrates an insight into the maritime history of three items restored on programme - a precious box, a book of cuttings about Captain Scott, and a handmade teddy bear.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chiang Mai to the River Kwai
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Thailand, from the northern city of Chiang Mai to Kanchanaburi on the River Kwai and from Bangkok to the southern beach resort of Hua Hin. Along the way, he tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cookery. He also stops off to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and admires the ruined temples at the former Siamese capital, Ayutthaya.(n)

programme.title: Jungle Atlantis
programme.desc: A thousand years ago, the Khmer people of Cambodia built an empire and their capital was the great city of Angkor, with its centrepiece being Angkor Wat - a vast temple complex covering an area more than four times the size of the Vatican City. In the first of this two-part programme, an international team of archaeologists and scientists use revolutionary technology to reveal the true scale and extent of the lost metropolis and find out how its people lived and died.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Full coverage of questions to the First Minister from the Senedd in Cardiff Bay.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane joins onion sellers in Brittany, who have delivered their products around the countryside and provided the stereotypical image of the Frenchman for the past 200 years.(n)

programme.title: World Beaters
programme.desc: A profile of gymnastics sensation Simone Biles, who won four golds at the 2016 Olympics in Rio de Janeiro.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Sue Barker narrates the second part of a look back at the Games, featuring days seven to 10, with Usain Bolt, Michael Phelps and Chris Hoy among those involved.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the first half of the Premier League fixture at Turf Moor, as the Clarets host Nuno Espirito Santo's Wolves. The sides shared the spoils in the reverse fixture, which took place back in August. Ashley Barnes gave Sean Dyche's men an early lead, but the home team rescued a point thanks to Raul Jiminez's penalty deep into stoppage time.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ellis family enjoys the new freedoms of the 1960s, from steak and chips and caravan holidays to muscle man competitions. Cameras follow dad as he puts in a shift down the local pit, while mum and girls head to the local phone box to try the new telephone recipe service. Presented by Sara Cox and Polly Russell.(n)

programme.title: Bears About the House
programme.desc: Part one of two. Conservationist Giles Clark embarks on his biggest mission to date - taking on the illegal wildlife trade and helping to build a new bear sanctuary in Laos, south-east Asia. Giles has been asked by good friend Matt Hunt, CEO of Free the Bears, to help for 12 months and is not long into his role when he has to step in to help Mary, a five-month-old sun bear. Mary was rescued after her mother was killed in the wild and was spotted on the back of a truck for sale into the illegal wildlife trade. Fragile and malnourished, she lives with Giles and Matt at home while she needs round-the-clock specialist care.(n)

programme.title: Mrs America
programme.desc: As Phyllis's campaign to stop the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment gathers support and momentum, its proponents prepare for the Democratic presidential campaign of 1972 and have a stark choice to make - the popular crowd-pleaser George McGovern or the trail blazing African-American Shirley Chisholm, who is determined to fight against a traditional white male preserve. Drama about the political movement to pass the Equal Rights Amendment in the US. Starring Cate Blanchett, Rose Byrne, Uzo Aduba and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Mrs America
programme.desc: In January 1973, the Supreme Court makes an historic judgement legalising abortion in the United States. The Womens' Caucus is in a buoyant mood and agrees not to confront Phyllis Schlafly's Stop the ERA campaign head-on, fearing that it would simply feed their publicity machine. Betty Friedan has other ideas and accepts an invitation to debate Schlafly at the University of Illinois. Drama about the political movement to pass the Equal Rights Amendment in the US. Starring Cate Blanchett, Rose Byrne, Uzo Aduba and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels the to the icy summit of Britain's highest and most wintery mountain, Ben Nevis, to discover how Scotland was first promoted as a winter holiday destination.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Emily Maitlis presents analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Iraq
programme.desc: Documentary examining the realities of war and life under Isis, with unique personal archive from civilians and soldiers from both sides of the conflict. As war began, many Iraqis were hopeful. Ahmed Al Bashir, now a renowned comedian, remembers practising his English with US troops before the realities of occupation became clear. Waleed Neysif was 18 when George Bush gave Saddam Hussein just 48 hours to leave Iraq. He was, like many Iraqi teenagers at that time, infatuated by the West. But while many of his generation grew up enjoying songs by the Backstreet Boys, Waleed formed Iraq's first heavy metal band. Narrated by Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: You Are What You Wear
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts the fashion makeover show, with volunteers including the husband-and-wife slimmer of the year champions, who are looking for outfits suitable for a glitzy, gold-themed ball, and 24-year-old Bournemouth woman Grace, who would like a wardrobe suitable for her new high-flying job. The stylists also get to choose over Jill, a 56-year-old raver who is looking for a style she can throw some serious shapes in, and Mel from Doncaster, who is keen to swap her all-weather obsession with flip flops and leggings for a sophisticated new look.(n)

programme.title: Inside Monaco: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: The programme goes behind the scenes as Casino de Monte Carlo holds an exclusive event with a Prohibition theme aimed at high rollers as it seeks to attract new clients, while at the palace Prince Albert II hosts the new French ambassador. In Monaco's only tattoo parlour, Princess Stephanie's daughter Camille Gottlieb is getting a discreet new inking and sharing what life is like for her in the principality, and four billion euros' worth of motor vessels enter the harbour for the annual yacht show.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The battle for the first two semi-final places in this year's competition reaches its climax, as the four remaining celebrities are tasked with cooking a faultless two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by three previous contenders - Olympic long-jumper Greg Rutherford, and TV personalities Vicky Pattison and Dom Parker. All three know what it takes to get through this competition and are in for a treat as their successors pull out all the stops to try to secure their semi-final place. For those who don't cut the mustard, the journey ends here.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges a sculptor, a ceramicist and a painter to create something to celebrate a couple's 25th wedding anniversary, on a budget of £800.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades uses archive and three barn fixes - a centuries-old clock, a toy and clocking-off machine - to explore how the invention of clockwork continues to influence modern life.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: Keeping Britain Going
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with the Heinz baked bean factory in Wigan, which has upped production to deliver almost 50 million cans in just a month, nearly double the number of tins the firm would normally sell in the same period. Operations manager John Brockley reveals how staff are keeping safe across the site, including passing through a thermal camera that automatically takes the temperature of workers as they enter the factory.(n)

programme.title: Jungle Atlantis
programme.desc: Part two of two. The experts continue their attempt to discover why Angkor suddenly collapsed, using a revolutionary technology called lidar to reveal the true scale and splendour of this abandoned megacity. Deep in the Cambodian jungle, they have discovered a sophisticated network of roads and canals that are the forgotten world of Angkor's greatest king, shedding new light on the dramatic events leading to the fall of the city.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus
programme.desc: A look at how Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus have fared at The Open, featuring first-person accounts from the trio, as they recount their famous victories.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores some of the most spectacular and scary sea cliffs in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Wildlife living on the Tibetan plateau - an inhospitable area the size of western Europe - including brown bears, yaks, giant sheep, snow leopards and the chiru or Tibetan antelope.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Sue Barker narrates the third part of a look back at the Games, featuring the final six days, as Victoria Pendleton, James DeGale and Christine Ohuruogu starred for Great Britain.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and David Harper assess items brought to Allerton Castle in North Yorkshire, while Paul Martin finds out about Harrogate's connection with Russia's last tsarina.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Sydney to Broken Hill - Part One
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores New South Wales by train, travelling 570 miles from Sydney to the mining city of Broken Hill. He explores the origins of Sydney as a penal colony, visits the Hyde Park barracks where many of the first convicts were housed and volunteers for the lifesaving club at Bondi Beach.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day one of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. This is the first meeting between the sides here in this format since June 2007, when England prevailed by 60 runs. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley presents the return of the contest in which aspiring make-up artists battle it out. Their first assignment is an advertising campaign for sports fashion retailer JD. Guest judge Min Sandhu reminds the amateurs that the make-up needs to be perfect but cannot distract from the clothing. The creative brief sees the artists producing looks based on their own identity - leading to transformations ranging from a prosthetics-based alien look to a mythical phoenix. Only then do the judges decide which two will take on the first elimination face-off.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig asks questions on the theme of reflections this week, with Joe Lycett, Zoe Lyons, Liza Tarbuck and Alan Davies trying to come up with interesting answers - while avoiding the most obvious ones.(n)

programme.title: There She Goes
programme.desc: Rosie is obsessed with Christmas, despite the fact that it is only mid-February, forever wanting to watch festive films on repeat and even dragging Simon to buy a tree. So when she finds another special day marked on the calendar - President's Day at the end of February - her parents wonder if celebrating that instead will help distract Rosie from her yuletide obsession. In the flashbacks to 2008, Emily and Simon are no longer talking, except to argue. But eventually, months of pent-up frustration comes to a head in an emotional showdown.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: When Nandor and Laszlo are abducted by a coven of witches, the others must venture to Brooklyn to rescue them.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The housemates try to survive without Guillermo as they prepare to attend the most exclusive event on the vampiric social calendar.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Mark Urban.(n)

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: Three-part documentary about the media mogul's influence on international politics and the power struggles within his own family. The first episode focuses on the 1997 general election, where Rupert Murdoch had to decide if his business interests were best served by the continuation of John Major's struggling government, or a new Labour leadership under Tony Blair. Eventually, the full force of his media empire is placed behind the rising Labour leader, but some question how high a price was paid. Elsewhere, Murdoch tries to decide which of his children will be the heir to his empire, and ambitious editor Rebekah Wade begins her rise to influence within the organisation.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a compilation of the show's most passionate contestants, including a health food entrepreneur who confused the panel with the precise composition of his low carb noodles, a couple who withhold a vital piece of information while pitching their iced tea company, and a former boxer-turned-inventor.(n)

programme.title: Italy's Frontline: A Doctor's Diary
programme.desc: Documentary featuring an unprecedented and intimate insight into three months of life on the Covid frontline in Italy with A&E doctor Francesca Mangiatordi. In the early days of the outbreak, the hospital is overflowing and Francesa works gruelling 12-hour shifts caring for those who have been most affected. Due to a lack of life-saving equipment she faces the traumatising task of prioritising which lives to try to save. At home, Francesca is fearful of infecting her husband, who suffers from a respiratory condition, and she hasn't touched him - or her children - for more than a month. Narrated by Florence Pugh.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A metal sculptor, a stained-glass designer and a textile artist pitch ideas for a Derby couple's wedding, with only two being made before the buyers choose their favourite.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: The importance of music in people's lives, through the restoration of a pump organ, an accordion and a bass guitar owned by a member of 1970s disco group Hot Chocolate.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo strikes west across Manitoba into the province of Saskatchewan. High above the Prairie at Riding Mountain, he discovers how a middle-class British boy from Hastings transformed himself into an influential indigenous naturalist called Grey Owl. Deep in the Prairie, he finds a network of railways that once served the wheat farmers of Saskatchewan, and learns how communities grew up around the grain elevators used to load the crops on to rail wagons.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: A look at how Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy have fared at The Open, featuring contributions from all three golfers.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Hermione Cockburn discovers the secrets to the success of British seaside towns on a visit to Blackpool's Pleasure Beach, and looks back at Rhyl's glory years through Victorian postcards. Neil Oliver also finds out about the people who manned Liverpool's dockyards.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: One Night In 2012: An Imagine Special
programme.desc: Alan Yentob looks back at the 2012 Olympics opening ceremony, with Danny Boyle and the creative team explaining the challenges that went into creating 'The Greatest Show on Earth'. With exclusive access to behind-the-scenes footage, from auditions through to the night itself, this is the story of 90 minutes that dazzled the world, including interviews with some of the 7,500 volunteers involved in the show, who discuss the friendships that were forged during the show and how it has affected their lives since.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Olympic Torch Story
programme.desc: A look back at the 70-day, 8,000-mile nationwide relay that captured the public's imagination in the build-up to the 2012 London Olympics, hearing from some of the 8,000 torchbearers. The film recalls moments including the torch zip-wiring across the Tyne Bridge, crossing the border in Ireland, climbing Mount Snowdon, being part of a marriage proposal and joining in ballroom dancing in Blackpool.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and David Fletcher are in Ushaw in County Durham, seeking a selection of objects to take to auction. Catherine falls in love with a model of Muffin the Mule and David is enchanted by a limited edition book by author JK Rowling. Presenter Paul Martin learns what life was like for the students who studied at Ushaw when it was open as a Catholic college.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Sydney to Broken Hill - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo continues his 570-mile journey through New South Wales. In the Blue Mountains, he learns about people's relationship to the land from his indigenous guide, before reaching Katoomba, where he rides the steepest railway in the world. He follows this with an overnight journey on one of the world's longest trains, the luxurious Indian Pacific Railway, which takes him to his destination - the mining city of Broken Hill.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day two of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. It is the first time this venue has hosted a Test match since last September, when England lost the Fourth Test of the 2019 Ashes series to Australia. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost brings viewers up-to-date on how his garden has been developing over the summer as well as offering advice on looking after and growing hydrangeas. In Devon, Toby Buckland shares tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials, while Frances Tophill travels to West Sussex to meet a gardener and professor of biology whose garden has been planted with the conservation of insects in mind. Plus, a second chance to see Carol Klein's in-depth profile of a national collection of hydrangeas at Darley Park in Derby.(n)

programme.title: A Wild Year
programme.sub-title: The North York Moors: A Wild Year
programme.desc: An exploration of the upland area of North Yorkshire, where heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales have been shaped both by the elements and by its people. Hardy Swaledale sheep roam the high moors all year round only coming down to the lowlands for lambing and shearing. Red grouse feed and breed amongst the heather alongside curlews and other ground nesting birds and billions of purple heather blooms provide nectar for the bees, brought to the moors by beekeepers in the summer. Toby Jones narrates, as time-lapse camera techniques bring fresh insight into the restless rhythms of the region.(n)

programme.title: I Love
programme.desc: Singer Adam Ant presents a retrospective look at the pop culture of 1981, when Kim Wilde, Clare Grogan and Tom Selleck were among the pin-ups. It was the year Britain was introduced to animated crimefighter Danger Mouse, the sport of darts was in its heyday, and the films Gregory's Girl and Porky's hit cinemas.(n)

programme.title: State of the Union
programme.desc: After reflecting on the fallout of the first week, Louise discovers something troubling about Tom. Rosamund Pike and Chris O'Dowd star in a comedy, written by Nick Hornby and directed by Stephen Frears.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Mark Urban presents analysis of the day's national and international events.(n)

programme.title: 20th Century Women
programme.desc: Comedy drama following a teenage boy, his mother and two other women who help raise him among the love and freedom of Southern California in 1979. Starring Annette Bening.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: How Scotland Cut Violent Crime - Panorama
programme.desc: While the rest of the UK has struggled to contain rising levels of knife and gun crime, Scotland has dramatically reduced violent crime in the past 15 years. But how was it done? Kate Silverton films with Police Scotland's Violence Reduction Unit, which tries to prevent crime by offering more help and compassion to those at risk of offending.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: When Nandor and Laszlo are abducted by a coven of witches, the others must venture to Brooklyn to rescue them.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The vampires prepare to attend the most exclusive event on the vampiric social calendar..(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: India plans an airport-inspired wedding, with a cup cake trolley dash for the passenger wedding guests and some tricky manoeuvring to guide her mother down the aisle.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood introduce another selection of clips, this time featuring pets, including a trip to a rabbit island, and a rat that chases cats.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and friends compete in a pedal car grand prix in Dorset..(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Blue Peter: Six Badges of Summer - Silver Week
programme.desc: The team present the last Six Badges of Summer show. Online campaigner Nikki Lilly reveals why viewers should earn their Silver Badge, Richie Driss tells his story in Draw My Life and chart star Becky Hill performs her new single Heaven on My Mind.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall sets out to visit six continents in search of Earth's 60 deadliest animals.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Moon
programme.desc: Using the latest and most detailed imagery, this documentary reveals the monthly life cycle of the moon as it waxes and wanes. From Wales to Wyoming, and from Hong Kong to Croydon, the programme explores how the moon shapes life across the planet earth, and uncovers more about the moon's journey around our planet and how it delivers one of nature's most awe-inspiring events, a total solar eclipse.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Golf: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at how Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy have fared at the Open, featuring contributions from all three golfers.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Golf: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at how Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus have fared at the Open, featuring first-hand accounts from the trio as they recount their victories.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain concludes her culinary road trip by sampling what Wales has to offer. She heads to the Brecon Beacons National Park to meet sheep farmer Richard Roderick, who gives her a crash course in the essential skills of a shepherdess. In return, she cooks him lamb bhuna, served with garlic naan. In Monmouth, Nadiya visits Desdemona Freeman and Denise Jones, the UK's only homegrown edible rosewater makers, harvesting petals and creating a rose and raspberry fool.(n)

programme.title: The Good Cook
programme.desc: Food writer Simon Hopkinson demonstrates how to create restaurant-quality food at home, preparing stuffed roasted peppers, steak and chips, aubergines with feta cheese, smoked haddock pilaf, and a rhubarb crumble. He also discusses his love of olive oil and Guernsey cream.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk and Anna Haugh prepare George V's favourite curry, Polly Russell discovers how Francis Drake solved a debt crisis and the secrets of a famous condiment are revealed.(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A bored millionaire masterminds a bank robbery, only to find himself pursued by a glamorous insurance investigator determined to prove his guilt. It is not long before they get embroiled in a passionate affair - but conflicting interests mean they can never really trust one another. Crime drama, starring Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke and Yaphet Kotto.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Michael Portillo rides the transcontinental Indian Pacific Railway from the southern port city of Adelaide to Perth in the west. Along the way he hears the story of how an enterprising 19th-century Briton with a murky past began to grow vines. Michael enjoys the fruits of his labours and hears his story from his great great great granddaughter. Later, the presenter embraces the luxury of a previous age as he travels across Australia's notoriously remote and inhospitable Nullarbor Plain.(n)

programme.title: Go Fish! with Will Millard
programme.desc: The presenter explores the controversial subject of shark fishing in Wales. After posting a photograph of a huge thresher shark on social media, he receives a backlash from his followers and the negative reaction prompts him to explore what it is like to catch the ultimate underwater predator. In Milford Haven, he joins a group of novices on a boat heading out into the Celtic Deep on the hunt for the blue shark. Will must make up his own mind about the merits of this type of fishing, but there is no doubt the Welsh coasts are abundant with unexpected marine life and large numbers of sharks.(n)

programme.title: Maleficent
programme.desc: A fairy falls in love with an ambitious human nobleman, who betrays her in pursuit of claiming the throne. She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.sub-title: The Open Championship 2019 - How Shane Won the Claret Jug
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents a look at Shane Lowry's triumph on home soil at Royal Portrush, setting a new course record on day three en route to winning by six shots in front of a passionate crowd. Actor James Nesbitt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day three of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. This is the first meeting between the sides here in this format since June 2007, when England prevailed by 60 runs. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: British History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley explores how in 1873 the British government enacted a coup to take over the rule of India from the huge and influential Honourable East India Company. The leaders of the company were presented as the villains, while Queen Victoria was elevated to the role of wise and benevolent Empress.(n)

programme.title: Rockfield: The Studio on the Farm
programme.desc: Documentary telling the unlikely tale of how brothers Kingsley and Charles Ward turned their dairy farm in Monmouth into a world-renowned recording studio, playing host to Black Sabbath, Queen, the Stone Roses, Oasis, Coldplay, Simple Minds, Robert Plant and Manic Street Preachers among others. Including contributions by Ozzy Osbourne, Liam Gallagher, Tony Iommi and Chris Martin.(n)

programme.title: The Duchess
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama, chronicling the life of Georgiana Spencer who became Duchess of Devonshire in 1774 at the age of 17. Adored by the public for her extravagant lifestyle, Spencer endured a troubled marriage and was eventually driven into the arms of Charles Grey, a senior Whig politician. Starring Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Rampling.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Mark Horton discovers how Swansea's monopoly on the copper trade in the 18th and 19th centuries was instrumental in helping Nelson to achieve victory at the Battle of Trafalgar. Neil Oliver travels to Langland Bay, meets the owner of Gower Salt Marsh Lamb and makes laverbread.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, with this episode's recipes linked by the letter S. Mary Berry prepares salmon with a fresh sorrel and spinach sauce, and Nigel Slater cooks sea salt chocolate snaps.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and garden designer Danny Clarke tackle a neglected and boring backyard in Birmingham for its owner Sophie, who wants the area full of birds, bees and butterflies.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Matt Baker visit the Blean, an ancient woodland in the heart of Kent where they get an exclusive look at a unique wilding project. There is a report from Gloucestershire on the elusive pine marten, while one of the driest springs on record is causing big problems at Adam Henson's farm.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost brings viewers up-to-date on how his garden has been developing over the summer as well as offering advice on looking after and growing hydrangeas. In Devon, Toby Buckland shares tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials, while Frances Tophill travels to West Sussex to meet a gardener and professor of biology whose garden has been planted with the conservation of insects in mind. Plus, a second chance to see Carol Klein's in-depth profile of a national collection of hydrangeas at Darley Park in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Carole Baxter demonstrates the difference between a bed of hardy annuals sown in a prepared bed alongside an unprepared bed, and George Anderson shows off his Joppa allotment.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
programme.desc: The food writer turns the contents of his weekly shop into seven more meals, showing how items that he often buys can be made more exciting by concocting delicious new flavour combinations. The dishes he ends up with include ricotta beefburger, smoked mackerel coleslaw, and lemon and thyme cake.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of Si King and Dave Myers' European baking tour takes them to France. Travelling from Lyon to Carcassonne, they learn the secrets of teeth-pulling nougat, go truffle hunting and meet up with Dave's old flatmate, whom he has not seen for 30 years. Culinary delights en route include tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette.(n)

programme.title: Stories of Us
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley and broadcaster Ashley John-Baptiste reveal the inspiring stories of people across the UK who lead spiritually and emotionally fulfilling lives. In this first edition, they set out to meet the people who have found inner peace, calm and equilibrium among the hustle and bustle of modern living. Kate takes to the open waters to experience how wild swimming has been a life-changer for some - and even a life-saver for others. Meanwhile, Ashley discovers how a little time living as a hermit could ease the pressures of busy lives.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: From the RAF Museum in Cosford, Shropshire, where antique experts Jonathan Pratt and Adam Partridge find a First World War pigeon capsule and a large collection of toy cars.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Continuing the third and final part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Over the past four weeks, 18 volunteers have experienced what life was like for the factory girls of the south Wales valleys in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. Now some of the women who lived through it for real talk about their lives, speaking of terrifying bosses, everyday sexism, union battles, camaraderie and of lifelong friendships forged on the production line. Presented by Alex Jones, who also reveals how the factory was brought back to life using these women's stories as inspiration.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day four of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. It is the first time this venue has hosted a Test match since last September, when England lost the Fourth Test of the 2019 Ashes series to Australia. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Sara Davies, Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of an eco-friendly entrepreneur's alternative to straws, a range of skincare products, a device designed to make bikes more visible, and a brand of food with a personal story behind it. Evan Davis presents.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan: From My Sofa
programme.desc: Romesh catches up with old friends from Albania, Mongolia and The Arctic, revisiting some of the highlights and introducing never-before-seen moments such as his near-death experience in a high-speed Mongolia car rally.(n)

programme.title: Trump in Tweets
programme.desc: Documentary taking an in-depth look at US President Donald Trump's use of social media, examining the impact of his tweets on politics both in America and across the world. With access to people in his inner circle, interviews with experts and journalists, as well as some of his most avid Twitter followers, the programme tells the story of how Trump has used Twitter as a tool to shape policy, conduct diplomacy and wage war on the establishment. Narrated by The Vivienne.(n)

programme.title: Donald Trump: All-American Billionaire
programme.desc: In a programme first shown in 2010, well before he became US President, Emily Maitlis profiles the property tycoon, exploring the controversy surrounding his plans to develop a golf resort on sand dunes near Aberdeen. She also investigates how he amassed his multi-billion-dollar fortune, and discovers why his extravagant lifestyle serves to reinforce his business brand. Featuring interviews with Trump himself, as well as members of his family and TV producer Mark Burnett, who helped make the businessman one of America's biggest small-screen stars on the original version of The Apprentice.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Advanced paramedic Kirsten is faced with an unusual job. A call has come in from police about a burglar who has injured himself trying to escape from the house he was looting. As she arrives, she finds him in agony with a nasty open fracture on his leg. Later, Kelsey and Dave are called to a pregnant woman in a lot of pain who worries she may be in early labour, and Gareth and Gabby treat a woman who is struggling with her breathing. But then two high-priority calls come in - both of which involve children.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the First World War's legacy on the UK today, through archive and delving deeper into three barn fixes - some bagpipes, a soldier's wire cutters and two RAF mascots.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet Revisited
programme.desc: Scientists find out what the future holds for the Great Barrier Reef, monitoring green turtles, following families of breeding birds and meeting the reef's curious residents.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by David Cornock..(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces dishes that are good to make in advance, including Mary Berry's fresh fruit salad, James Martin's chicken stew, the Hairy Bikers' autumn pudding, Nigel Slater's bean soup, and Nigella Lawson's ice-cream cake.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan narrates a documentary following capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis as they strive to raise their families. The first episode sees the young animals taking their first steps in some of the world's most extraordinary habitats, where they have to beware of deadly predators including the jaguar and caiman.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The first of five programmes looking back at the 2016 Rio Olympics, focusing on the opening six days - which included Adam Peaty's 100m breaststroke gold medal in the pool.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and James Lewis scour a crowd at Ushaw in Co Durham to find objects to take off to auction. Catherine comes across a toy speedboat in its original box and James discovers a rare poster that came from a morgue which shows the average weight of adult organs. Host Paul Martin looks at some rare Catholic artefacts that survived the English Reformation.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey from Adelaide to Perth, striking gold and playing cards in Kalgoorlie, and uncovering a dark chapter of the past in Perth.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day five of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. England are hoping to avenge a series defeat away to the Windies last summer. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: The comedy of Victoria Wood is celebrated by Richard E Grant, with characters including Kimberley's friend, Jim Broadbent's northern playwright and Patricia Routledge's extraordinary monologues as Kitty. With contributions from Julie Walters and Michael Ball, as well as rare behind the scenes photos from her personal archive.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Leicester pit their wits against a team from Durham University in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Iraq
programme.desc: A look at the impact of the insurgency from the perspectives of American soldier Lt Col Nate Sassaman and Baghdadi Alaa Adel, who was 12 when she suffered life-changing injuries. Unprepared for the hostile environment he found himself in, Sassaman was pushed to the very darkest regions of his psyche. Alaa was hit in the face by shrapnel from one of the first roadside bombs planted by insurgents and intended for American forces. Looking back at that time, both question the benefits of the war in Iraq.(n)

programme.title: Strasbourg 1518
programme.desc: Jonathan Glazer's short dance film inspired by an event in which an involuntary mania took hold of citizens in the city of Strasbourg just over 500 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Wedding Planner
programme.desc: The exclusive world of Lelian Chew, who organises nuptials for the super-rich in the Far East, taking on 10 just ceremonies a year at an average cost of $1million each.
